summary: This is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (S2 20 Cr. 330) submitted to Judge Nathan regarding proposed juror strikes. It includes modifications to the defense's previous strikes and is transmitted by defense attorney Christian Everdell.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who transmitted the joint letter to Judge Nathan regarding proposed juror strikes in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (S2 20 Cr. 330), to whom the joint letter regarding juror strikes is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330), which is the subject of the juror strike proceedings.

persons.name: Sternheim
persons.context: Person copied on the email transmitting the joint letter regarding juror strikes in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

connections.description: Christian Everdell is transmitting a joint letter on behalf of the defense regarding juror strikes in Maxwell's criminal case.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
Everdell is submitting a joint letter to Judge Nathan regarding juror strikes in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Submission of Joint Letter on Juror Strikes
events.description: The prosecution and defense jointly submit a letter to Judge Nathan regarding proposed juror strikes in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, including modifications to the defense's previous strikes.

keyFacts: The document is a joint letter from both parties in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case regarding proposed juror strikes.
The letter includes modifications to the defense's previous strikes, indicating ongoing pretrial jury selection negotiations.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330, presided over by Judge Nathan.
The communication is transmitted by defense attorney Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP.
